oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Communication from the Inspector's Office in Richmond, Virginia, on furnishing a tabular statement of the operations of an office
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Confederate States of America -- Army -- Virginia Cavalry Regiment, 3rd.; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Handbooks, manuals, etc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Communication from the Inspector's Office in Richmond, Virginia, on furnishing a tablular statement of the operations of an office, December 27, 1864. An example of form to be submitted each month is hand-drawn at the bottom of the letter.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- War Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Though army regulations volumes conveyed the format of basic military forms, this document illustrates another method used to pass along the proper form to maintain.
